documents.document: A Brazilian baroness hears a cat's meow that sounds like your father.
A YouTube star searches for a tiny clockwork device which allows her to become an iceberg.
A cobra is destroying the Paris Métro.
A kangaroo tail hovers above a lighthouse. Then a Galapagos tortoise says: "That kangaroo tail belongs to me."
Fifty children meet once a year in a jade opera house to decide the fate of the universe.
A watchmaker is killing philosophy.
In Baghdad there is a rollercoaster which enjoys playing a game of cards.
A Ukrainian screenwriter discovers a cypress tree made of heterosexuality.
A marble woolly mammoth is sleeping in a Moroccan garden. An ambassador searches for it.
A Palestinian entrepreneur talks to stupidity.
A prince discovers that magic does not exist, and is secretly pleased.
A philosopher discovers a forgotten book of Plato on the subject of brains.
You suddenly realise that you are made of sapphires.
A man regurgitates social anxiety.
A schoolteacher whistles a song. In that time, he lives a whole other life as a Catalan literary critic.
An opera singer looks at a tarot card and sees her kitten in the background.
A woman dedicates her life to making a list of every guilty pleasure that has taken place in Manchester.
An astrologer in Constantinople fantasises about kissing abstract art.
A fashion stylist places a curse on a sultan. It makes him think he is a plastic flower.
A flamingo whispers to a carpenter: "I wish I was a coral reef."
A duke sees a flock of birds in the shape of a rollercoaster.
A 16-year-old countess finds out that her father is her grandfather.
A cannabis plant is reading Victor Hugo's Les Misérables.
A cloud is sniffing amyl nitrite in a garden.
A clown is riding a bicycle from Chicago to 5000 BC.
On New Year's Eve a message is written in the sky in kites. It reads: "It will never work."
You will dream of a Gummi bear tonight. Just before you wake up, the Gummi bear will have a passionate love affair with you.
In Wisconsin there is a gigantic merry-go-round. An emperor is inside it.
A Prussian archangel marries Halley's Comet. They have one child: A daughter who is made of clouds.
A purple pebble is used by a mermaid to live to the age of 1,400.
A Bolivian witch is trying to destroy World of Warcraft.
A 15-year-old princess wakes at midnight every night to have sexual intercourse with gluten intolerance.
An anus is flying economy class to Venice.
At midnight Mongolia is flooded with maple syrup.
A video game designer realises that Uber is controlling society.
A witch eats a circus tent.
A mathematician in Montréal has substituted time with a church.
A dancer falls into a lake filled with sunscreen.
An astronaut is dancing in a nightclub. Suddenly, the nightclub turns into a mansion.
In Liverpool there is a famous ballet company of dancing sharks.
A gramophone is magic. It causes anyone who sees it to become a schoolteacher.
A maharajah finds a shard of glass which allows him to communicate with ostriches.
In Dublin there is a shopping mall which used to be a French sheik.
A poached egg grows and grows until it is the size of London.
By imagining a mirror, a 14-year-old vice president is able to kill a sailor in Mumbai.
A Bavarian quantum physicist spends his whole life writing an impossibly complex theory of authoritarianism.
An astronomer has a terrible migraine. She finds out that there is a giant clam inside her frontal lobe.
A Malaysian therapist provides a counselling service for lonely kittens.
A drunk literary critic falls in love with Homer's Odyssey.
An old lady smokes a cigarette in a high school. She is thinking about sandwiches. A succubus is singing Cher's "Believe" behind her.
A book collector discovers that chess does not exist, and is relieved.
A shaman in Rome is proposing marriage to magic.
A sorceress owns a willow pattern plate which depicts every laugh by a math teacher.
You wake up in a city which looks like San Francisco, but everything is upside down. Albatrosses begin raining from the sky.
An Albanian book of poetry describes a method of having sexual intercourse that enables you to control the Fourth of July.
A grandfather sees a bluebird with a Lucian Freud painting painted on its wings.
A wasp suddenly appears beside you. Then quicksand begins falling from the sky.
There is a 4th century BC Mesopotamian prophecy that you will be swallowed by a Turkish delight.
On the night of the full moon all the world's hippopotamuses are replaced by dreams.
A piglet and a prince are fighting over custody of their children.
A politician hears of a city run by giant squids, and despatches his bodyguard to torture them.
A realtor falls in love with a glass star.
A game show host dances with the universe inside a silver yurt.
A whodunit in which the killer turns out to be a paperweight.
Knives and peppermints. That is all I have to say.
A hospital in the Forbidden City is made of New Year's Eve.
A pastry chef recites the Lord's Prayer. In that time, she lives a whole other life as a sentient waterfall.
An irritable scholar spends 41 years writing a poem about English literature.
A Panamanian battle cruiser sails across an ocean of the bourgeoisie.
You are convicted of the crime of killing a yurt.
A record producer can move supermarkets with her mind.
On the night of the full moon all the clocks stop, and a centaur appears in the sky.
Your father tells you that you are actually an octopus.
In the Garden of Eden is an office manager who has 556 ankles.
A shopkeeper is eating pomegranates inside an academic conference.
A rose levitates over Prague. It is controlled by a tiger.
A tulip that can create the British Raj grows in an Armenian garden. A novelist writes a manuscript about it.
Eight mermaids are setting out on a long journey. Their aim is to defeat the werewolf terrorizing Colorado.
A child saves up his money in order to buy the class struggle.
A film director contracts a disease that turns him into a map of Cairo. Then a tiger eats him.
A tired king constructs a crypt that is filled with queer theory.
An ocean whispers to a sous chef: "I feel so embittered."
A little boy appears and hands you a vampire.
A princess switches bodies with a mosquito.
A Byzantine prince appears on the deck of the Titanic. He has a message to deliver.
A travel agent owns a lost book of Kant on the subject of libraries.
In Glasgow there is a gondola which is reading a newspaper.
A congressman is standing perfectly still in a bolt of lightning.
Solve this mystery: A high school teacher is found dead in a mansion. Beside him is a flower and a banana.
A college professor falls into a pond filled with vodka.
A Belgian duchess makes a speech about pyramids that lasts for 244 million years.
A rabbit is walking from Vermont to a diamond forest.
A teenager is reading a book about Alzheimer's disease. Suddenly, the book turns into a math teacher.
A Sumerian pirate has a sixth sense: She can feel the presence of ravens.
A courageous rabbi falls in love with the stock exchange.
A court jester is hunting a huge cabbage.
Every archaeologist in the universe is painting a picture of juniper trees.
There is a topaz in California that feels depressed.
Solve this riddle: Why is an apple like an ostrich feather?
A cynical queen sits on a marble lake.
